abstract.p: Jerry Courville Jr takes first-round lead in Met Life/MGA Open golf tournament (S)

block.p: Jerry Courville Jr., in quest of the only Metropolitan Golf Association title that has eluded him, shot a four-under-par 67 yesterday and took the first-round lead in the Met Life/M.G.A. Open at the Mountain Ridge Country Club in West Caldwell, N.J.

Courville, 41, who has won three M.G.A. Amateur titles and three M.G.A. Ike titles, is trying to become the fifth amateur to win this event. His father, Jerry Courville Sr., now dead, was one of the four.

Jerry Courville Jr., in quest of the only Metropolitan Golf Association title that has eluded him, shot a four-under-par 67 yesterday and took the first-round lead in the Met Life/M.G.A. Open at the Mountain Ridge Country Club in West Caldwell, N.J.

Courville, 41, who has won three M.G.A. Amateur titles and three M.G.A. Ike titles, is trying to become the fifth amateur to win this event. His father, Jerry Courville Sr., now dead, was one of the four.
After a round that produced six birdies and a pair of bogeys, Courville held a one-stroke lead over P. J. Cowan, who captured his third New York State Open in four years last month.
Mark Brown, last year's winner, opted for the P.G.A. Championship this week.
